name: Art of Storytelling
usp_of_course: Small group classes with individual feedback
Interactive, fun and activity-based
Showcase event to perform to an audience
Certification and individual assessment
full_description: Children are natural storytellers. We help them engage their imagination and use words to structure and express their ideas. In this course, the students will learn to build a story with story elements, and practice delivery through expressions, voice modulation, tone and body language. It is structured as a group class to help students develop inter-personal and listening skills, and make new friends. With a play-based interactive approach, these sessions are designed to get even shy children to open up easily. They hone their comnunication skills and confidence, while engaging in fun activities. At the end of course, we organise a showcase where the students tell the story that they have created infront of an audience, online. Come, imagine and create with us!
pitch: Learn to communicate ideas by learning to build stories. Practice narration and voice modulation.
short_pitch: What's more fun than making stories! Master the art of communicating ideas and bringing them to life with story elements. Practice story narration to develop confidence and oratorship.
social_proof: This course is loved by 5-9 yrs old!
curriculum_liner: In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes
curriculum_outcomes: Identify the various elements and structure of a story (e.g., character, setting, plot, problem, resolution)
Create a story using different elements
Narrate a story in their own words with expression and modulation
Engage an audience in their story narration

curriculum_sessions.title: Introduction to Storytelling
curriculum_sessions.details: Create a short story and describe it to your peers.

curriculum_sessions.title: Plot of a Story
curriculum_sessions.details: Understand various elements of a plot and create one of their own.

curriculum_sessions.title: Types of Stories
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn about different types of stories - Fables, Anecdotes and Magical Stories.

curriculum_sessions.title: Building the Character
curriculum_sessions.details: Develop the characters and their actions for your own stories.

curriculum_sessions.title: Building the Setting
curriculum_sessions.details: Draw the setting of your story.

curriculum_sessions.title: Visuals in Storytelling
curriculum_sessions.details: Create character and setting props to enhance the storytelling experience for an audience.

curriculum_sessions.title: Monologues and Dialogues
curriculum_sessions.details: Create monologues and dialogues for your characters.

curriculum_sessions.title: Hooking the Audience
curriculum_sessions.details: Create engaging hooks for your story.

curriculum_sessions.title: Original Story
curriculum_sessions.details: Write an original story using all the elements.

curriculum_sessions.title: Group Rehearsal
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice in front of the class and learn to give feedback.

curriculum_sessions.title: Revision and Group Rehearsal
curriculum_sessions.details: Revise all the key concepts and continue practise for showcase.

curriculum_sessions.title: Showcase
curriculum_sessions.details: The budding storytellers will present an original story to an audience.

expert_details.expert_description: Priyanka Babbar has 12+ years of experience and has conducted 200+ storytelling sessions globally. She currently teaches Drama at NSS Hill Spring International School.
expert_usp_pointers: Participated in Theatre Olympics in 2018
Professional Theatre Artist
Studied at London International School of Performing Arts

name: Public Speaking
usp_of_course: Small group classes with individual feedback
Interactive, fun and activity-based
Showcase event to perform to an audience
Certification and individual assessment
full_description: Children often shy away from speaking in public or even infront of their peers in class, while being talkative otherwise. In our course, we guide the children to overcome the hesitation of delivering speech infront of an audience. In this course, the students will practice different styles of public speaking such as improvisation, informative, and persuasive style of delivery, which they can apply in their everyday life â€“ such as speaking in class, in a school assembly or a poetry recital, participating in elocution or debate competitions. The course will enable them to deliver speech in a crisp, engaging, and a memorable way. We use topics which are relatable and topical for the children. At the end of the course, students deliver a speech on a given topic infront of an audience, online! In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes-Understand different types of speeches-Learn to developthe structure of each speech-Develop non-verbal skills to build a connection with the audience for an effective delivery-Understand the relevance of public speaking in a real-life scenario
pitch: Master the most sought-after 21st century skill - oratory, through interactive speaking activities
short_pitch: The one skill that leaders have in common, it is the skill to speak confidently infront of an audience! This is what makes Public Speaking the most sought-after 21st century skill. Learn to create different types of speeches and practice to deliver them confidently.
social_proof: Children find the classes fun and interactive, and dislike missing sessions.
curriculum_liner: In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes
curriculum_outcomes: Understand different types of speeches
Learn to develop the structure of each speech
Develop non-verbal skills to build a connection with the audience for an effective delivery
Understand the relevance of public speaking in a real-life scenario

curriculum_sessions.title: Speech & Delivery
curriculum_sessions.details: Understand speech and delivery as two elements of Public Speaking.

curriculum_sessions.title: Improptu Speech
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice Impromptu Speech/No-Prep Speech using picture clues.

curriculum_sessions.title: Introduction to Persuasive Speech
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice writing a persuasive speech

curriculum_sessions.title: Mini Project I
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice delivery of a persuasive speech.

curriculum_sessions.title: Introduction to Informative Speech
curriculum_sessions.details: Identify the importance of informative speech.

curriculum_sessions.title: Mini Project II
curriculum_sessions.details: Write and deliver an informative speech.

curriculum_sessions.title: Ideate
curriculum_sessions.details: Prepare an informative or a persuasive speech using visuals/words.

curriculum_sessions.title: Research, Revise & Edit
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn to research, revise and edit your speech.

curriculum_sessions.title: Non-Verbal Communication
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn the importance of non-verbal communication while delivering a speech.

curriculum_sessions.title: Rehearsal 1
curriculum_sessions.details: Rehearse your speech and get feedback from the teacher.

curriculum_sessions.title: Rehearsal 2
curriculum_sessions.details: Final practice before the delivery infront of an audience.

curriculum_sessions.title: Showcase
curriculum_sessions.details: Present final speeches to the audience.

expert_details.expert_description: Tirthankar holds a Degree in Education from Azim Premji University and comes with a deep insight into curriculum development and pedagogical expertise through his experiences at Teach for India and LEAD School as an educator.
expert_usp_pointers: Masters Degree in Education
6+ years of teaching and creating content for 1000s of schools

name: Dramatic Storytelling
usp_of_course: Small group classes with individual feedback
Interactive, fun and activity-based
Showcase event to perform to an audience
Certification and individual assessment
full_description: Lights, camera, action!! Any student who wants to perform in a play on stage, this course is the best way to build that foundation. In this course, the students will learn foundational elements of drama. These elements are the tone, costumes, body language, and the environment at the time of storytelling. They will develop stories, and learn to deliver them to make it engaging and immersive for the audience.  At the end of course, we organise a showcase where the students performance infront of an audience, online. In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes â€“ Understand the use of different voices, pause, tone, pitch to communicate the feelings of the character in your story â€“ Learn to use non-verbal communication such as eye-contact, body language, facial expression, gesturesâ€“ Learn to create an experience for the audience by providing sound effects.â€“ Use props/costume to signify characters and their actions.
pitch: Ready for the spotlight? Develop voice modulation, expressions and body language to captivate audiences
short_pitch: Witness live theatre experience at home with costumes, props, sound effects, and a whole lot of action! Learn how to bring different characters in a story to life through voice, expressions, and actions. Practice to overcome your fear of stage by performing infront of an audience.
social_proof: Children don't want this course to end!
curriculum_liner: In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes
curriculum_outcomes: Understand the use of the voice and the body to bring different characters to life
Learn about a variety of engaging methods to grab the attention of the audience
Gain confidence to communicate with others in different situations
Application of all of these in real life presentations and performances at school

curriculum_sessions.title: Creating Characters
curriculum_sessions.details: Create unique characters based on different situations.

curriculum_sessions.title: Using the body to become a character
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn different techniques to incorporate the mannerisms and movements.

curriculum_sessions.title: Creating Dialogue
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn how to create dialogues for a story.

curriculum_sessions.title: The Story Structure & Storyboarding
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn to create a storyboard.

curriculum_sessions.title: The Body and the Voice
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn different techniques for modulating voice.

curriculum_sessions.title: Non-Verbal telling
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn to communicate through non-verbal methods using gestures and expressions.

curriculum_sessions.title: Object Play
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn the use of simple objects in the story to bring imagination to life.

curriculum_sessions.title: Dress-Up!
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn to use simple items as costumes for the story performances.

curriculum_sessions.title: Gearing Up!
curriculum_sessions.details: Rehearse with costumes, stage & dialogues.

curriculum_sessions.title: Gearing Up!
curriculum_sessions.details: Rehearse with costumes, stage & dialogues.

curriculum_sessions.title: Gearing Up!
curriculum_sessions.details: Rehearse with costumes, stage & dialogues.

curriculum_sessions.title: It’s Showtime!!
curriculum_sessions.details: Present the performance in front of an audience.

expert_details.expert_description: Priyanka Babbar has 12+ years of experience and has conducted 200+ storytelling sessions globally. She currently teaches Drama at NSS Hill Spring International School.
expert_usp_pointers: Participated in Theatre Olympics in 2018
Professional Theatre Artist
Studied at London International School of Performing Arts

name: Debate
usp_of_course: Small group classes with individual feedback
Interactive, fun and activity-based
Showcase event to perform to an audience
Certification and individual assessment
full_description: Debating is a powerful activity that develops cognitive and communication skills in children. Some of the most impressive public leaders are ex-debators â€“ from Barack Obama, Nelson Mandela, Jeff Bezos to Oprah Winfrey. Being a great orator is a key part of leadership. This course is designed to engage children through speaking activities which impart skills and techniques while making it super easy and fun to participate. Through structured debate sessions, children will also prepare with research, collaborate, practice their arguments and rebuttals. With each debate exercise, they also learn to view topics from multiple angles and develop the ability to navigate differences in opinion respectfully. No prior experience is required. At the end of the course, the students get in groups and debate on a topic in front of an audience, online. In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes-Understand the debate format of communications and itâ€™s structure-Practice micro-skills used in debate - stating opinion, effective opening and closing, rebuttal-Develop critical thinking skills-Practice delivery with appropriate modulation and body language-Learn to research and prepare for a debate
pitch: Got an opinion? Now learn to be a formidable communicator!
short_pitch: Do you know what do Barack Obama, Nelson Mandela, and Oprah Winfrey have in common? All of them are legendary orators! Learn to structure your arguements, and practice delivering them in a respectful and assertive way.
social_proof: Students find it refreshing that an argument can be respectfully communicated.
curriculum_liner: In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes
curriculum_outcomes: Understand the debate format of communications and it’s structure
Practice micro-skills used in debate - stating opinion, effective opening and closing, rebuttal
Develop critical thinking skills
Practice delivery with appropriate modulation and body language
Learn to research and prepare for a debate

curriculum_sessions.title: Opinion and Tall tale
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice stating an opinion and telling a tall tale.

curriculum_sessions.title: Descriptive Speech
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice narration and descriptive speech.

curriculum_sessions.title: Speech Fluency and Building an Argument
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice building an effective and persuasive argument.

curriculum_sessions.title: Rebuttal
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn about rebuttal and practice counter-arguments while being respectful.

curriculum_sessions.title: Effective Opening and Closing
curriculum_sessions.details: Build a strong opening and closing for your debate using techniques and formats.

curriculum_sessions.title: Impromptu Speech
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice to articulate clearly in impromptu (unprepared) speech occasions.

curriculum_sessions.title: Team Debate
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn and practice the structure of a team debate.

curriculum_sessions.title: Presentation Skills
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn to pay attention to body language and gestures, and use it to deliver different types of impact.

curriculum_sessions.title: Debate Preparation
curriculum_sessions.details: Prepare for the final debate with your team.

curriculum_sessions.title: Showcase
curriculum_sessions.details: Present final debate infront of an audience.

name: Western Vocals - Beginner
usp_of_course: Small group classes with individual feedback
Customised to match pace of learning
Go towards mastery with further levels
Certification and individual assessment
full_description: Neuroscientists have shown how music engages and strengthens practically every area of the brain. Learning music helps children build their linguistic and memory skills. That said, the joy of music is a gift that keeps on giving! The voice happens to be the one instrument we all grow up playing and using. We all sing from a young age and learn to appreciate the talent of those who have learnt to use it well. This will serve as the starting point for that journey, there are no pre-requisites and you don’t need to have any background in singing or any training in music theory. In this course, we will cover 3 pillars crucial to the development and interest in music and singing: Performing, appreciating and composing. The performing element is important for children to have fun singing their favourite songs. The appreciating element is important for children to listen to and understand different kinds of music, singers and genres. The composing element will allow children to use what they have learnt to make something unique to their voice. This course has two levels and as students progress from one level to the other, they build deeper understanding of music. The learning outcomes for the two levels are given below: Western Vocals Beginner:– Understand pitch and rhythm with appropriate singing technique– Learn about dynamics, phrasing and interpretation – Be able to sing songs of different genres and cultures– Write a short piece and sing a self-composed melody Western Vocals Intermediate:- Learn how to sing a major and minor arpeggio- Recognize melodies and difference in vocal tone, be able to repeat and retain them- Recognize visually and aurally the difference between subdivisions- Use and recognize kodaly rhythm syllables- Understand the vocabulary of rhythm notation- Recognize and sing three different notesNumber of sessions: 12 sessions + 12 at home materials for the student to do post session Duration of each session: 1 hour each
pitch: Level up from bathroom singer! Learn to sing, appreciate and even compose music as you learn the fundamentals
short_pitch: Level up from bathroom singer! Learn to sing, appreciate, and even compose music as you learn the fundamentals.
social_proof: Total excitment about composing their own music.
curriculum_liner: In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes
curriculum_outcomes: Understand pitch and rhythm with appropriate singing technique
Learn about dynamics, phrasing and interpretation
Be able to sing songs of different genres and cultures
Write a short piece and sing a self-composed melody

curriculum_sessions.title: Introduction to Major Scale
curriculum_sessions.details: Introduce building blocks of music - Melody, Rhythm and Solfege with hand signs.

curriculum_sessions.title: Introduction to Expression
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn about pitch, volume & tempo.

curriculum_sessions.title: Major Scale and Rhythm
curriculum_sessions.details: Sing the major scale along with rhythm using metronome.

curriculum_sessions.title: Learning a Song
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn a new song in English.

curriculum_sessions.title: Singing in a Group
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice all the verses of the song.

curriculum_sessions.title: Intervals
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice all the verses of the song.

curriculum_sessions.title: Large and Small Intervals
curriculum_sessions.details: Distinguish between large and small intervals.

curriculum_sessions.title: Be a Composer
curriculum_sessions.details: Write a simple melody.

curriculum_sessions.title: Be a Composer
curriculum_sessions.details: Write a simple melody and set it to rhythm.

curriculum_sessions.title: Around the World
curriculum_sessions.details: Listen and practice songs in different languages.

curriculum_sessions.title: Sing in a New Language
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn a new song in a foreign language.

curriculum_sessions.title: Assessment
curriculum_sessions.details: Perform and receive feedback.

expert_details.expert_description: Meera Desai is a singer and songwriter with 10+ years of experience. In New York, she received training in western classical and jazz.
expert_usp_pointers: 10+ years of singing and songwriting
Best Female Vocalist Award in 2020
Toured with bands such as Heat Sink

usp_of_course: Small group classes with individual feedback
Customised to match pace of learning
Go towards mastery with further levels
Certification and individual assessment
full_description: Neuroscientists have shown how music engages and strengthens practically every area of the brain. Learning music helps children build their linguistic and memory skills. That said, the joy of music is a gift that keeps on giving! The voice happens to be the one instrument we all grow up playing and using. We all sing from a young age and learn to appreciate the talent of those who have learnt to use it well. This will serve as the starting point for that journey, there are no pre-requisites and you don’t need to have any background in singing or any training in music theory. In this course, we will cover 3 pillars crucial to the development and interest in music and singing: Performing, appreciating and composing. The performing element is important for children to have fun singing their favourite songs. The appreciating element is important for children to listen to and understand different kinds of music, singers and genres. The composing element will allow children to use what they have learnt to make something unique to their voice. This course has two levels and as students progress from one level to the other, they build deeper understanding of music. The learning outcomes for the two levels are given below: Western Vocals Beginner: – Understand pitch and rhythm with appropriate singing technique – Learn about dynamics, phrasing and interpretation – Be able to sing songs of different genres and cultures – Write a short piece and sing a self-composed melody Western Vocals Intermediate:- Learn how to sing a major and minor arpeggio - Recognize melodies and difference in vocal tone, be able to repeat and retain them - Recognize visually and aurally the difference between subdivisions - Use and recognize kodaly rhythm syllables - Understand the vocabulary of rhythm notation - Recognize and sing three different notes

short_pitch: Level up from bathroom singer! Learn to sing, appreciate, and even compose music as you learn the fundamentals.

curriculum_outcomes: Learn how to sing a major and minor arpeggio
Recognize melodies and difference in vocal tone, be able to repeat and retain them
Recognize visually and aurally the difference between subdivisions
Use and recognize kodaly rhythm syllables

curriculum_sessions.title: Dynamics and Tempo
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn different dynamics and tempos in a song.

curriculum_sessions.title: Arpeggios and Chord
curriculum_sessions.details: Sing major and minor arpeggios. Learn minor and major chords.

curriculum_sessions.title: Melodies and Beat
curriculum_sessions.details: Recognise melodies and identify the starting beat of a song.

curriculum_sessions.title: Subdivisions
curriculum_sessions.details: Understand subdivisions - note values and read the syllables.

curriculum_sessions.title: Sight Reading and Time Signatures
curriculum_sessions.details: Read simple rhythm sight reading and identify time signatures.

curriculum_sessions.title: Minor Scale
curriculum_sessions.details: Understand the difference between the major and minor scale.

curriculum_sessions.title: Be a Composer
curriculum_sessions.details: Review sight reading of rhythm and write their own rhythm.

curriculum_sessions.title: Around the World
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn a composition in a different language and from a different culture.

curriculum_sessions.title: Pitch Reading
curriculum_sessions.details: Understand the concept of reading simple pitches along with rhythm.

curriculum_sessions.title: Practice Minor Scale
curriculum_sessions.details: Sing the minor scale independently

curriculum_sessions.title: Recap and Assessment
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice singing major and minor scales, and a song independently.

curriculum_sessions.details: Perform and receive feedback

name: Stop Motion Animation - Junior (Beginner)
usp_of_course: Guaranteed to be the most fun class ever
Build your own portfolio
Go towards mastery with further levels
Certification and individual assessment
full_description: Everyone loves a good story! Distracted by gadgets as we are today, why don’t we use those gadgets to our advantage? Stop Motion Animation course is ideal for your child to channel their imagination and creativity into making their own short film! Because of stop motion animation’s simple nature of capturing and showcasing stories, it becomes a super easy concept to grasp for kids of all ages. It allows children to enjoy unstructured play, sequencing and structuring their thoughts with immediate visual outputs. In this course, students will learn the basics of animation and then go deeper into the process to create sophisticated animated films. They will make detailed scenes and actions by employing professional methods and techniques used by top animation studios today. Students will engage in character building exercises, set-construction and work with different media like craft paper, clay, cardboard, felt, wires and many more. Light and sound techniques are essential elements to build stories and effects, students will learn to use these. Through this course, students will work on one animated story, layering it with more detail and elements over each class, to culminate into a high-quality animated film (As a side benefit, working across weeks on one ‘masterpiece’ also develops focus and patience in children, who are otherwise easily distracted!). They will also learn to use the technique in other fun ways such as flipbook and creating their own animated gifs. No prior experience is needed.
pitch: Make your own animated films and let your imagination run wild. This is the most fun course. Ever!
short_pitch: Everyone loves a good story! Distracted by gadgets as we are today, why don’t we use those gadgets to our advantage? Make your own animated films, Gifs, and flipbook, and let your imagination run wild. This is the most fun course. Ever!s
social_proof: 'Can I also attend this course with my child? It is a great way to learn a skill together' a parent after attending the trial class
curriculum_liner: In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes
curriculum_outcomes: Students will understand stop motion animation and its structure
Build their visualization and storytelling skills.
Iterate and experiment with different materials and techniques.
Make their own short animated film, and one additional format (Gif/Flipbook)

curriculum_sessions.title: Rules of Stop Motion Animation
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice using the stop motion app and basic story building.

curriculum_sessions.title: Sequencing 2D & 3D
curriculum_sessions.details: Work with 2D and 3D media to create short animations.

curriculum_sessions.title: Working with multiple media
curriculum_sessions.details: Use different materials to create setting and characters of the story.

curriculum_sessions.title: Movie Set-Up
curriculum_sessions.details: Create a storyboard and plan characters, scenes and the set for the shoot.

curriculum_sessions.title: Movie - Shoot
curriculum_sessions.details: Shoot the film, add sound, and edit with post-production on the app.

curriculum_sessions.title: Make your Own GIF/Flipbook
curriculum_sessions.details: Develop GIFs or flipbook using the app.

curriculum_sessions.title: Make your Own GIF/Flipbook
curriculum_sessions.details: Develop GIF s or flipbook using the app.

name: Stop Motion Animation - Senior
usp_of_course: Guaranteed to be the most fun class ever
Build your own portfolio
Learn to create GIFs and Flipbooks
Certification and individual assessment
full_description: Everyone loves a good story! Distracted by gadgets as we are today, why don’t we use those gadgets to our advantage? Stop Motion Animation course is ideal for your child to channel their imagination and creativity into making their own short film! Because of stop motion animation’s simple nature of capturing and showcasing stories, it becomes a super easy concept to grasp for kids of all ages. It allows children to enjoy unstructured play, sequencing and structuring their thoughts with immediate visual outputs. In this course, students will learn the basics of animation and then go deeper into the process to create sophisticated animated films. They will make detailed scenes and actions by employing professional methods and techniques used by top animation studios today. Students will engage in character building exercises, set-construction and work with different media like craft paper, clay, cardboard, felt, wires and many more. Light and sound techniques are essential elements to build stories and effects, students will learn to use these. Through this course, students will work on one animated story, layering it with more detail and elements over each class, to culminate into a high-quality animated film (As a side benefit, working across weeks on one ‘masterpiece’ also develops focus and patience in children, who are otherwise easily distracted!). They will also learn to use the technique in other fun ways such as flipbook and creating their own animated gifs. No prior experience is needed.
pitch: Make your own animated films and let your imagination run wild. This is the most fun course. Ever!
short_pitch: Everyone loves a good story! Distracted by gadgets as we are today, why don’t we use those gadgets to our advantage? Make your own animated films, Gifs, and flipbook, and let your imagination run wild. This is the most fun course. Ever!
curriculum_liner: In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes
curriculum_outcomes: Gain an in-depth understanding of animation – materials and methods
Learn to work on character building and short film narratives
Practice professional model building, light and photography techniques
Make their own short animated film, and create Gifs and flipbook

curriculum_sessions.title: Rules of Stop Motion Animation
curriculum_sessions.details: Practice using the stop motion app and basic story building.

curriculum_sessions.title: Sequencing 2D & 3D
curriculum_sessions.details: Work with 2D and 3D media to create short animations.

curriculum_sessions.title: Character Building
curriculum_sessions.details: Create characters and their actions in the story.

curriculum_sessions.title: Scenes & Sequences
curriculum_sessions.details: Create sequences & scenes for the shoot.

curriculum_sessions.title: Set for the shoot
curriculum_sessions.details: Create the set for the shoot.

curriculum_sessions.title: Light
curriculum_sessions.details: Create different settings for the movie.

curriculum_sessions.title: Sound
curriculum_sessions.details: Add narration and sound effects to the movie.

curriculum_sessions.title: Final Movie
curriculum_sessions.details: Edit with post production on the app.

curriculum_sessions.details: Develop your own GIFs using the app.

name: Photography
usp_of_course: Learn the science behind clicking photographs with professional photographers
Small group classes with individual feedback
Build your own portfolio
Certification and individual assessment
full_description: Photography is the perfect tool to harness a childâ€™s creativity and curiosity. Developing a keen eye at a young age can help enhance the way you view and interact with the world. Moreover, it is easy and fun. Photography course will cover key concepts such as composition, correctly balancing exposure and light, types of photography (portrait, silhouette, panorama) and a brief history of the medium. We will train the eye to really observe details, and equip students with the tools required to effectively capture the world around them, find beauty in the things they see (and see them in different ways), and tell a story through images. It is a hands-on course where students will be encouraged to explore their surroundings and apply what they learn in each session in a fun and stimulating way. No prior experience of photography is required. A basic digital camera is preferred, though a cell phone camera will also suffice. DSLRs are welcome too. Come, letâ€™s learn to see the magic in the ordinary.
pitch: Put your unique lens on the world as you learn to capture stunning pictures armed with techniques and tricks
short_pitch: Put your unique lens on the world as you learn to capture stunning pictures armed with techniques and tricks. All you need is a smartphone and a lot of imagination!
social_proof: Anyone can learn to click beautiful photos, it is that simple!
curriculum_liner: In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes
curriculum_outcomes: Understand the basics of photography
Learn to compose and shoot stunning images
Practice different styles of photography
Make their own collection of photographs

curriculum_sessions.title: Camera and Composition
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn how cameras work and rule of thirds.

curriculum_sessions.title: Viewpoint
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn about viewpoint and leading lines.

curriculum_sessions.title: Exposure and Aperture
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn about one exposure element, aperture and depth of field.

curriculum_sessions.title: Shutter Speed & ISO
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn about the remaining elements of exposure such as shutter speed and ISO.

curriculum_sessions.title: Landscape Photography
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn about types of shot and landscape photography.

curriculum_sessions.title: Portrait Photography
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn the difference between landscape and portrait photography.

curriculum_sessions.title: Showcase
curriculum_sessions.details: Present Photo Story to an Audience.

expert_details.expert_description: Rohit Saha is a visual artist and was a professor at NIFT. He completed his Masters in Photography from the National Institute of Design, Gandhinagar. He has been published in notable publications including Indian Express and The Caravan.
expert_usp_pointers: Photojournalist
Masters of Photography from National Institute of Design (NID)
Visiting faculty, NIFT

name: Art Explorer
usp_of_course: Learn different types of media and mediums in art
Small group classes with individual feedback
Build your own portfolio
Certification and individual assessment
full_description: All children love art, and while it may appear as fun and games, children develop spatial intelligence and innovative, original thinking.  As the name suggests, the Art Explorer course is designed to help students explore various forms and media such as collage, finger painting, paper weaving, and clay. Exploring various art forms broadens the childâ€™s understanding of what art is and how they can â€˜createâ€™ in multiple ways. From exploring colours to 3D forms, each class brings a new way to look at art. Through the process, children will learn basic techniques and make connections with life around them. Students need no prior training for this course. The materials needed are basic art supplies such as drawing paper, colours (crayons/oil pastels, water colours), coloured paper, modeling clay and so on. The teacher will guide them at every step.
pitch: Learn fundamentals techniques, explore and get inspired by global artists, and find your own artistic style.
short_pitch: The ultimate exploration in art with a variety of media and styles to unlock creativity
social_proof: Children love the vibe of this class and chit chat with teachers as they create art.
curriculum_liner: In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes
curriculum_outcomes: Demonstrate appropriate use of different media to communicate themes and ideas in their work
Identify between elements and principles in own work and the works of others with focus on shape, colour, and texture
Discuss and identify how and where art is used in their everyday life
Make connections between the visual arts and learning in other curricula areas

curriculum_sessions.title: Collage Making
curriculum_sessions.details: Create collage using coloured paper.

curriculum_sessions.title: Paper Weaving
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn to weave paper to create different pattern.

curriculum_sessions.title: Scribbled Art
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn tricks of creating scribbled art.

curriculum_sessions.title: Clay
curriculum_sessions.details: Create different objects from clay.

curriculum_sessions.title: Shapes to Create
curriculum_sessions.details: Use cut-outs of shapes to create different objects.

curriculum_sessions.title: Watercolor
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn flatwash technique to create a painting.

curriculum_sessions.title: Showcase
curriculum_sessions.details: Present all the artwork to an audience.

name: Art Beginner
usp_of_course: Learn what's taught in college-level art degrees, with artists
Build your own portfolio
Small group classes with individual feedback
Certification and individual assessment
full_description: Art is a universal language to express ideas and emotions. Children love art, but rarely get a structured education on mastering techniques and unlocking creativity. In this course, students will learn powerful, yet simplified, concepts to make their drawing better and learn colour theory and techniques of application. They will also discuss artwork of famous artists such as Vincent Van Gogh, Claude Monet, Henri Matisse, Georges Seurat and Paul Signac, and learn art appreciation. Through learning and exploration, students are also encouraged to look at art in multiple ways, and evolve their own style. No prior training is required.
pitch: Learn fundamentals techniques, explore and get inspired by global artists, and find your own artistic style.s
short_pitch: Learn the fundamental techniques, get inspired by artists from around the world, and find your own artistic style.
curriculum_liner: In this course, the students will achieve the following outcomes
curriculum_outcomes: Understand lines, pattern and 2D and 3D drawing
Understand colour theory and application techniques
Study artworks of known global artists
Try different subjects such as single-point perspective, patterns in nature and 3D scenes

curriculum_sessions.title: Line and Curve
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn to draw different lines and curves.

curriculum_sessions.title: Introduction to 2D Forms
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn to draw 2D shapes and basic objects.

curriculum_sessions.title: Introduction to Colours
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn about primary and secondary colours.

curriculum_sessions.title: Introduction to Patterns
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn about patterns through exercises.

curriculum_sessions.title: Introduction to 3D Forms
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn to draw 3D shapes and basic objects.

curriculum_sessions.title: Colour & Shades
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn how to create colour shades, tones, and tints

curriculum_sessions.title: Patterns in Nature
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn to identify patterns in nature and draw them.

curriculum_sessions.title: Perspective (1 point)
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn about single-point-perspective and use it to draw simple 3D-scapes.

curriculum_sessions.title: Perspective (1 point)
curriculum_sessions.details: Learn to draw simple paintings using single-point-perspective.

curriculum_sessions.title: Create Your Own Form
curriculum_sessions.details: Create forms based on your surroundings.

curriculum_sessions.title: Recap
curriculum_sessions.details: Revise key concepts of form, colour & pattern.

curriculum_sessions.title: Finale
curriculum_sessions.details: Create a painting using the techniques learnt in the course.

expert_details.expert_description: Richa is a watercolor artist in Singapore. She is a trained dentist and has been dabbling in art for the 5 years. She has conducted 100s of workshops for children and adults in Singapore.
expert_usp_pointers: Singapore-Based Watercolor Artist
Conducted 100+ workshops for children & adults
